intro: Impatiens hukaungensis, commonly known as the Hukaung impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest undergrowth, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
